I just click in godot editor executable but it opens my last edited game. Before that, godot was opening the project window with the same size of my game (400x680).

**Steps to reproduce:**
I don't konw, I goes open the editor and now it just open my last edited game.
I solved the problem temporally with just deleting the ~/.godot folder, but after close the editor, it reopen my game project, even now without any project list.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: AStar weight scale applied to whole path during solve?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
X11, 64 bits, 2.1.3 and 3.0

**Issue description:**
Trying to make a board game style hex tile map. Connecting points and giving most points a weight of 1, and some points a weight of 2. Expected solution would be to consider moving through 2-weighted cells to cost 2 move points and 1-weighted cells to cost 1 point.  Looks like weight gets multiplied to the whole distance calculation (*= used in line 194 or 222, etc). I saw it avoiding a path of 8 2-weighted cells and choosing instead 22 1-weighted cells.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a hex tile map and add only the hexes that have a tile on them as points in A-Star. connect all adjacent hexes. Give some cells a weight of 2 and some a weight of one, making some paths theoretically cost more. When path is solved, the shortest path often doesn't seem to properly factor cost as per cell, but cumulative instead. Pretty hard to explain, but it seems wrong to me.


**Link to minimal example project:**
I'll make a sample project and add it soon...it'll take a little extra time. Wanted to get issue raised first.

data.title: Feature request: Quick trails, vector fields and collisions for particles
data.body:
Unreal engine has very robust modular particle system which allows for some great stuff: https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Engine/Rendering/ParticleSystems/Reference/index.html
It would be great to have some of these features available in godot right away without messing with shaders. 

Vector fields allow for some really funky and great particle spreading effects that I'm sure a lot of games would benefit from: https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Engine/Rendering/ParticleSystems/Reference/Modules/VectorField/index.html 

Benefits of having collisions and trails quickly available I'm sure I don't even need to describe, that stuff is great.

data.title: Revert "Use .godot as file extension for project files."
data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#8375

data.title: Added a number of primitive objects
data.body:
This PR adds a number of new 3D objects to the node tree. Each object is generated by code in a similar fashion as the TestCube and Quad objects are.

They differ in a number of ways:
- UV coordinates ensure no overlapping on the surfaces
- Mapping contains tangent information so normal maps can be used
- Each object can be subdivided, this allows for vertex shaders to be used to further modify the objects.

Here is a test project that showcases the new objects:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/TestPrimitives

data.title: texture set_data not working on android
data.body:
**Android - Godot 2.1.3 stable:**


**Issue description:**
get_texture().set_data(....) not doing anything on android.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a scene with a Sprite node (2d)
- Add the following script to the node:
```
extends Sprite
var img
func _ready():
	img = get_texture().get_data()
	set_process(true)
	
func _process(delta):
	var i
	for i in range(64):
		img.put_pixel(i,i, Color(1,0,0,1)) 
	get_texture().set_data(img)

```
It works on linux but not on android

**Link to minimal example project:**

[set_data.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/965998/set_data.zip)

data.title: HTML5: Implement mouse lock/capture and hiding
data.body:
Implements `set_mouse_mode` and `get_mouse_mode` for `MOUSE_MODE_VISIBLE`, `_HIDDEN` and `_CAPTURED` in HTML5 export.

For `MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED`, [security restrictions](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/learning/workflow/export/exporting_for_web.html#security-restrictions) require capturing the cursor from within an input callback.

`MOUSE_MODE_CONFINED` cannot be implemented in browsers.

Fixes #7675

data.title: Remove GLUT usage in HTML5 platform
data.body: GLUT was useful to get the platform started, but has been slowly replaced by other Emscripten APIs due to various limitations. These changes remove the last remaining uses of the GLUT interface.

data.title: Adds "completed" signal to GDFunctionState
data.body:
Closes #3235

Allows code like this:

``` GDScript
func _ready():
    whatever()
    print("_ready finished")

func whatever():
    var ret = yield(do_something(), "completed")
    prints("do_something() returned:", ret)

func do_something():
    print("do_something began")
    yield(get_node("timer"), "timeout")
    print("do_something resumed")
    return 13

# Output
# _ready finished
# do_something began
# do_something resumed
# do_something returned: 13
```

Rejoice.

**Note:** In the above example, `whatever()` would never be resumed if `do_something()` used a normal yield which returns a `GDFunctionState` that must be manually resumed. I think that's what #7618 complains about.

data.title: Moving more thirdparty stuff (minizip, some single-file external libs) to the thirdparty directory
data.body:
That has been on my TODO list for a while... moving the big libraries to `thirdparty/` was a first step, but we still had some small single-file libraries bundled in `core/` and a few other places.

With this PR, most such external sources should be properly split to thirdparty, thus handling most files mentioned in #5248.

Still bundled are (that I know of):
- some platform-specific code: Android, BB10, UWP (check #5248)
- bundled source in `servers/physics/gjk_epa.cpp`
- bundled source in `servers/physics/joints_{,2d_}sw.cpp`

If you know of more bundled thirdparty code, I'm interested :)

data.title: Detect SSE/SSE2 for libsquish.
editor automatically change image
data.body:
## Operating system or device - Godot version:
Operating system: Windows 7
Godot version: 2.1.3

## Issue description:
**what happened**
Repo mark png as changed but external editor has only re-save the image.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/25533420/e2cb4850-2c30-11e7-9fa8-a1036a2ddd96.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/25532540/f870a928-2c2d-11e7-8444-027e55bcbf21.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/25534506/39ae24d2-2c34-11e7-91c0-cafcc90bdfdb.png)

I don't know if it has something to do with this editor setting:
```
on_save/compress_binary_resources = true
on_save/save_modified_external_resources = true
resources/save_compressed_resources = true
```

**what was expected**
If re-saving a image with an external editor without any changes, Godot should not change the image.

## Steps to reproduce:
1. create a image
2. save it inside open godot project
3. check in repo
4. re-save it with external editor
5. godot automatically change image

nothing much changes in visual, but make editor theme to control globally.
And now icon margin is smaller on scene tree dock.

data.title: OpenVR Module for Godot 3.0
data.body:
This is a Godot 3.0 version of #7968 based on the new AR/VR server logic. 

There is a test Godot project here to test with:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/godot3_test_projects/tree/master/TestGodotARVR

It looks like tracking is working properly at the moment however I'm still having problems with outputting to the HMD with the newer approach.

Note that to compile you'll need to get the latest OpenVR SDK from here:
https://github.com/ValveSoftware/openvr
And place the contents in thirdparty/openvr
The files that are in the Godot repository are incomplete due to all the binaries that are delivered.

On Windows make sure to copy the openvr.dll file from thirdpaty/openvr/bin/winxx into the folder containing your godot.exe

On Mac OSX make sure to copy the framework for openvr from thirdparty/openvr/bin/osxxx into Godot.app/Contents/frameworks

I am unsure about the steps required for Linux.

data.title: AR/VR base classes and position tracker support
data.body:
This PR replaces #8025 as a Godot 3.0 implementation.

Instead of adding the tracker logic into INPUT this has now got its own singleton in the form of ArVrServer. New to this is the introduction of interfaces on which AR and VR implementations can be build. I will shortly add a PR with a sample implementation for OpenVR. @Hinsbart and myself are however thinking of replacing these implementations using GDNative.

I am still working on this PR as I am planning on adding basic tracking support for mobile VR as I did with the original PR for Godot 2.0

data.title: Light2D with shadows enabled near an occluder displays errors instead of shadows
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: 3 master**
Using Nvidia 375.39 drivers.

**Issue description:**
Light2D starts spamming "meseges" when shadow is enabled and a LightOccluder2D is in range.
This happens in editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**
 - Create a LightOccluder2D.
 - Add a Light2D with the occluder in range.
 - Enable shadows on the Light2D.
 - Watch the terminal output get eclipsed by meseges.

--------------

The message spammed when turning shadows in editor is:
```
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL	Type: Error	ID: 1282Severity: High	Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. Array object is not active.
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

```

------------------

Turning on the shadow while running got an extra error sometimes between the other:
```
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL	Type: Error	ID: 1282Severity: High	Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. Invalid VAO/VBO/pointer usage.
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

```

--------------------

And this error too but saw it while running other things (sometimes while opening the editor) so I guess it is not related
```
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL	Type: Performance	ID: 131218	Severity: Medium	Message: Program/shader state performance warning: Vertex shader in program 4 is being recompiled based on GL state.
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

```

data.title: Added recent scripts to script editor
data.body:
Added recent scripts and help files to the script editor, via menu or `ctrl+shift+T`.  Does not work with builtin scripts.

Contains a setting for how many scripts count as recent.

data.title: Add one-way collision to tile-set/tile-map (2.1)
data.body:
Now you can set **one_way_collision_direction**/**_max_depth** on a tile's static bodies. During conversion to a `TileSet` it will be checked whether all static bodies for a given tile have the same values for those. If that's not met, a warning will be printed and the relevant tile will be converted with one-way collision disabled (all zeroes for those properties).

At runtime multiple physics bodies will be created for `TileMap`'s quadrants as needed. That is, one physics body per quadrant per different set of one-way collision parameters. I've optimized the code as much as possible to recycle physics bodies so to avoid as much creation/freeing as possible at runtime in case tiles are changed dynamically.

_**This deserves some testing. I will be testing it heavily myself.**_

Not sure what to do about _master_. @reduz said in 3.0 those properties would be probably added to the collision shapes instead, so this implementation would be meaningless for it.

Closes #2585 (but only for _2.1_).

data.title: Add "node" to signal's Add Extra Call Argument in GUI!
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
V2.1.2

**Issue description:**
This is weird because programmatically we can just do:

`control.connect("mouse_enter", self, "MouseEnterFunction", [control])`

then
```
func MouseEnterFunction(node):
    print(node)
```


which works fine.

However... when connecting signals through the GUI:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/25475210/daec94be-2aea-11e7-9ecd-a92891be05c7.png)


There is no option to pass the node itself! Only types.
